channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead baby fox on residential road, 27th June
item.description:
There is a dead baby fox on the residential road on Southborough lane by the parade of shops outside Marks Fish and Chip shop. It could cause some upset to any children walking by for school or get further squashed as in a parking bay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 231, Southborough Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning from two cherry trees outside 71 Witham Road, 27th June
item.description:
The pavements and kerbs and road side need cleaning. Debris from trees, leaves and cherry pips and skin from the trees are a slip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights stay on red, 27th June
item.description:
When I leave work at 5am this light are always on red and don’t change so if I am by welling station going onto belgrove road I have drive though a red light this only case in morning rest day they are fine so I think it something to do with timer on lights this been case for a few months now so it lights next to welling station leading to belgrove road light stay on red when I go work at 5am
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 126, Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hackney Council Worker, 27th June
item.description:
For the previous two mornings, the man working for hackney council sweeping/cleaning the area has been playing loud music from 6am. This is very unfair to tenants who are still resting/have children resting.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Peters Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public urination in fenced off nature reserve, 27th June
item.description:
Since the creation of the fenced off nature reserve by the Lansdowne Drive entrance to London Fields, there is constantly people urinating there, particularly behind the large tree. It is worst on the weekends but also occurs in the week.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lansdowne Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
